results.title: Ngaya (I Am)
results.credit_line:
With Rhian Hinkley and composer Harry Covill

Commissioned by ACMI
results.brief_description:
“Ngaya (I Am) is a cut-and-paste, punked-up look at my Country. It looks at Country from an insider-outsider perspective… and uses humour to disarm the viewer about the true nature of invasion.”

Shirtless men dance under a mirror ball and a jet ski skims flood waters as Ngarigo Country burns. Peter Waples-Crowe layers footage from tourism campaigns, ads for the Snowy Mountains Hydroelectric Scheme and amateur YouTube movies, as well as newly recorded video and animations of his distinctive paintings. These visions of Ngarigo Country are collaged atop colonial paintings, including Eugene von Guérard’s “North-east view from the northern top of Mount Kosciusko” (1863).

Paintings like this perpetuated the myth of terra nullius, and Peter’s work dismantles the legacy of erasure and misrepresentation by interrogating the way non-Indigenous people construct images of Aboriginal land and people. Through this searing yet playful contrast, he mocks non-Indigenous visions of Country that view it as something to be stolen, owned and exploited – nothing but ski slopes and untapped riches.

As someone who views his Country from afar, Peter repurposes these fragmented images to piece together the multiple layers of his identity – proudly inserting them back into the landscape and proclaiming, ‘We are still here’.

constellations_primary.name: The ‘Australian' alps
constellations_primary.description: These feature films and documentaries show how stories have been told to lay claim - and reclaim - the land and our national identity.

results.title: Universal Appliance Co.
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Michaeley O'Brien, Ruth Kleinhenz and Andrew Lancaster
results.brief_description: 1. An inventor finally gets a chance to mass produce his latest creation at the Universal Appliance Company factory. The production line runs smoothly until advertising and romance become distractions. Another multi-award winning production for director and sound designer Andrew Lancaster.

results.title: My shadow
results.brief_description:
Flat tyres, mystery calls. Cathy is being watched. Someone is following her, close as a shadow. Cathy tells her best friend. Heath already knows. The phone rings through the night. Is anyone listening?
A beautifully hand-drawn 2D animated narrative which captures the sense of frustration and fear when your life appears threatened by an unknown stalker and no-one out there is listening to your cries for help.

results.title: The Real Story of Captain Cook's Death
results.brief_description:
Captain Cook encounters new territory and claims it. He is attacked by a native of the island and so flees. The native gets subsequently eaten by a big fish.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Mysteries of Ludwig Leicheart
results.brief_description:
This short film depicts the historical journey across the Top End made by Ludwig Leicheart and his horse Rusty. They eat and sleep and upon waking, Leicheart gets attacked and killed by a dingo. Leicheart’s trusty horse avenges his master’s death by killing the dingo.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Flash trip to the beach
results.brief_description: This home movie takes us back to an era when holidays seemed longer, days sunnier and road safety was much less of an issue. Older Bayside residents will be interested in scenes taken of Brighton streets and the Kinane Street beach. A man and a boy take a trip to the beach on the back of a motorbike.

results.title: Do you believe in ghosts?
results.brief_description: A young John Straford again stars in this editing exercise as a skeptic whose compusure is shaken by a very untoward event. The back garden sets the scene.
